page.title: 09LEE MOOR-CHINA CLAY-TRANSP.
page.content: There are no major waterways or railway lines in the area.This means that anything which has to be carried, has to go by road.Fortunately,the china clay can be gravity fed (suspended in water)to Marsh Mills for drying,through a pipe.However,the better quality clay (S.P.S.)is taken back up to Lee Moor by road to be further refined,and then carried again to where it is needed by road.Carrying the clay by road is only viable for the better quality clays.The cost of carrying the waste sand by road is not viable in economic terms,which is why the waste tips have developed.Another problem with the sand is that it tends to be 'sharp' sand,which requires more cement than other types of sand to make concrete.Other uses for this sand are being sought but at the moment no other use is considered to be viable.
